questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : SOFTWARE ENGINEERING (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is not an Integrated Development Environment (IDE)?
question_texts: Which of the following is not an Integrated Development Environment (IDE)?

options.option_text: Statement 1 is correct, Statement 2 is incorrect.
Statement 1 is incorrect, Statement 2 is correct.

questions.question_text_1:
A software engineer is working on fixing an issue with a third-party payment processing service in an e-commerce platform. To identify the problem, the engineer starts by reviewing the API documentation, example codes, etc.. 
Which of the following debugging strategies is being used by the engineer?
question_texts:
A software engineer is working on fixing an issue with a third-party payment processing service in an e-commerce platform. To identify the problem, the engineer starts by reviewing the API documentation, example codes, etc.. 
Which of the following debugging strategies is being used by the engineer?

questions.question_text_1:
A hiring manager is conducting an interview with a candidate. Instead of following a predefined set of questions, the manager asks open-ended questions and adapts the follow-up questions based on the candidate's responses, allowing for a free-flowing conversation. 
Which type of interview is the manager conducting?
question_texts:
A hiring manager is conducting an interview with a candidate. Instead of following a predefined set of questions, the manager asks open-ended questions and adapts the follow-up questions based on the candidate's responses, allowing for a free-flowing conversation. 
Which type of interview is the manager conducting?

questions.question_text_1:
In the design of an e-commerce platform, different modules handle tasks like managing product listings, processing customer orders, and handling payment transactions. While each module focuses on its own task, they all need to access a shared order database to retrieve and update order statuses, customer information, and payment details. 
Identify the correct statement about the modules of the given application.
question_texts:
In the design of an e-commerce platform, different modules handle tasks like managing product listings, processing customer orders, and handling payment transactions. While each module focuses on its own task, they all need to access a shared order database to retrieve and update order statuses, customer information, and payment details. 
Identify the correct statement about the modules of the given application.

options.option_text: The modules have high cohesion and are highly coupled.
The modules have low cohesion and are highly coupled.
The modules have low cohesion and are loosely coupled.
The modules have high cohesion and are loosely coupled.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following diagrams models the sequence of message exchanges among parts of a system?
question_texts: Which of the following diagrams models the sequence of message exchanges among parts of a system?

options.option_text: To decide which work is to be done in the current sprint and how the chosenwork will be done.
To prioritize the work for the development team.
Team demonstrates what they have completed in the given sprint.
To evaluate the last sprint - team dynamics, processes, tools etc.

questions.question_text_1: Suppose the risk assessed for budget slippage is 1.8, and the probability of budget slippage occurring during project development is 0.9. What is the impact of budget slippage on project development?
question_texts: Suppose the risk assessed for budget slippage is 1.8, and the probability of budget slippage occurring during project development is 0.9. What is the impact of budget slippage on project development?

questions.question_text_1:
Consider a file-sharing application that allows users to upload and share files with others directly. The files are stored on the users' devices and exchanged directly between users, without relying on a central server for storage or transmission. 
What type of software architecture is most likely used for the file-sharing application?
question_texts:
Consider a file-sharing application that allows users to upload and share files with others directly. The files are stored on the users' devices and exchanged directly between users, without relying on a central server for storage or transmission. 
What type of software architecture is most likely used for the file-sharing application?

questions.question_text_1:
A company is building a tool for its own developers to streamline the software development lifecycle. The tool will primarily be used for managing version control, tracking bugs, and automating deployment pipelines. 
In this case, which type of clients are we dealing with?
question_texts:
A company is building a tool for its own developers to streamline the software development lifecycle. The tool will primarily be used for managing version control, tracking bugs, and automating deployment pipelines. 
In this case, which type of clients are we dealing with?

questions.question_text_1:
Consider a software organization X has developed a complete software product and wants to ensure it works well in real-world scenarios by getting feedback from actual users before the final release. 
Identify the type of testing X wants to perform.
question_texts:
Consider a software organization X has developed a complete software product and wants to ensure it works well in real-world scenarios by getting feedback from actual users before the final release. 
Identify the type of testing X wants to perform.

questions.question_text_1:
A food delivery app is shared with a predefined set of customers. The customers report an issue where the delivery tracking feature displays incorrect locations for delivery drivers, causing confusion about the estimated delivery time. 
This activity is part of which phase of the software development lifecycle?
question_texts:
A food delivery app is shared with a predefined set of customers. The customers report an issue where the delivery tracking feature displays incorrect locations for delivery drivers, causing confusion about the estimated delivery time. 
This activity is part of which phase of the software development lifecycle?

questions.question_text_1:
In an agile project, the team is working on implementing a user story. If the user story cannot be completed within one iteration (1-2 weeks), the team decides to subdivide it into smaller, more manageable ones. 
What does this approach make the user story?
question_texts:
In an agile project, the team is working on implementing a user story. If the user story cannot be completed within one iteration (1-2 weeks), the team decides to subdivide it into smaller, more manageable ones. 
What does this approach make the user story?

questions.question_text_1:
Imagine a food delivery application where users can search for restaurants, place orders, and track deliveries. However, the application fails to provide any real-time updates about the progress of the order or the delivery. 
Which design heuristic is lacking in this scenario?
question_texts:
Imagine a food delivery application where users can search for restaurants, place orders, and track deliveries. However, the application fails to provide any real-time updates about the progress of the order or the delivery. 
Which design heuristic is lacking in this scenario?

questions.question_text_1:
Consider an e-commerce platform that integrates with multiple payment gateways. The platform has a payment processing system that only accepts payments in USD, but the payment gateways provide transaction amounts in different currencies, such as EUR and INR. The class PaymentProcessor can only handle USD amounts, but the payment gateways provide transaction amounts in incompatible currencies. 
Which design pattern can be used to solve the problem?
question_texts:
Consider an e-commerce platform that integrates with multiple payment gateways. The platform has a payment processing system that only accepts payments in USD, but the payment gateways provide transaction amounts in different currencies, such as EUR and INR. The class PaymentProcessor can only handle USD amounts, but the payment gateways provide transaction amounts in incompatible currencies. 
Which design pattern can be used to solve the problem?

questions.question_text_1:
Consider the following requirements for a mobile app that allows users to book and manage appointments at a healthcare clinic: 
Requirement 1: The mobile app must be able to support at least 500 simultaneous user logins. Requirement 2: The mobile app must allow users to view the available doctors and their appointment slots. Requirement 3: The mobile app must notify users when an appointment is successfully booked. Requirement 4: The mobile app must be able to process payments for appointments within 3 seconds. 
Which of the following statements is true?
question_texts:
Consider the following requirements for a mobile app that allows users to book and manage appointments at a healthcare clinic: 
Requirement 1: The mobile app must be able to support at least 500 simultaneous user logins. Requirement 2: The mobile app must allow users to view the available doctors and their appointment slots. Requirement 3: The mobile app must notify users when an appointment is successfully booked. Requirement 4: The mobile app must be able to process payments for appointments within 3 seconds. 
Which of the following statements is true?

options.option_text: Requirements 1, 2, and 3 are functional requirements, whereas requirement 4is a non-functional requirement.
Requirements 2 and 3 are functional requirements, whereas requirements 1and 4 are non-functional requirements.
Requirements 1 and 4 are functional requirements, whereas requirements 2and 3 are non-functional requirements.
Requirement 2 is a functional requirement, whereas requirements 1, 3, and 4are non-functional requirements.

questions.question_text_1: Which requirement collection technique involves gathering detailed information from recorded procedures, rules, steps, and regulations pertaining to a specific task or activity?
question_texts: Which requirement collection technique involves gathering detailed information from recorded procedures, rules, steps, and regulations pertaining to a specific task or activity?

questions.question_text_1:
A software company is developing a mobile app for a government agency to monitor and control traffic systems in real-time. The app requires integration with multiple hardware devices, real-time processing, and strict security protocols. The developer team consists of highly skilled professionals.  
The values for the constants in the COCOMO model for the different types of projects are as follows: 
• Organic project: a = 2.4, b = 1.05 • Semi-detached project: a = 3.0, b = 1.12 • Embedded project: a = 3.6, b = 1.20 
Consider the source code to be 1,00,000 lines. 
Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts:
A software company is developing a mobile app for a government agency to monitor and control traffic systems in real-time. The app requires integration with multiple hardware devices, real-time processing, and strict security protocols. The developer team consists of highly skilled professionals.  
The values for the constants in the COCOMO model for the different types of projects are as follows: 
• Organic project: a = 2.4, b = 1.05 • Semi-detached project: a = 3.0, b = 1.12 • Embedded project: a = 3.6, b = 1.20 
Consider the source code to be 1,00,000 lines. 
Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1:
A logistics company is developing a route optimization system for its fleet, relying on a third-party mapping API to provide real-time traffic data and calculate optimal delivery routes. However, there is a risk of shortcomings in the third-party API. 
Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

options.option_text: By hiring developers with relevant experience within the company and/ oroutside the company, or outsource certain things to some third party vendors.
By benchmarking and regular inspection to verify that the external componentis up to the mark.
By communicating with clients or build prototype to collect clients feedback

props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### Software Engineering Concepts
1. **Integrated Development Environment (IDE)**
   - Tools: Visual Studio Code, PyCharm, Thonny
   - Non-IDE: TextEdit (Mac)

2. **Version Control with Git**
   - `git pull`: Fetches and merges changes from the remote repository.
   - `git fetch`: Retrieves changes from the remote repository without merging.

3. **Debugging Strategies**
   - Input Manipulation
   - Backwards Strategy
   - Forwards Strategy
   - Blackbox Debugging

4. **Interview Types**
   - Structured Interview
   - Semi-structured Interview
   - Unstructured Interview
   - Questionnaires

5. **Cohesion Types**
   - Coincidental Cohesion
   - Procedural Cohesion
   - Communicational Cohesion
   - Sequential Cohesion

6. **Coupling and Cohesion**
   - High Cohesion and High Coupling
   - Low Cohesion and High Coupling
   - Low Cohesion and Loose Coupling
   - High Cohesion and Loose Coupling

7. **Diagrams in Software Engineering**
   - Class Diagram
   - State Machine Diagram
   - Activity Diagram
   - Interaction Diagram

8. **Agile Project Management**
   - Sprint Retrospective: Evaluates the last sprint, team dynamics, processes, and tools.

9. **Risk Management**
   - Risk Impact Calculation: \( \text{Impact} = \text{Risk} \times \text{Probability} \)
   - Example: Impact of budget slippage = 1.8 * 0.9 = 1.62 (not directly listed, closest is 2)

10. **Software Architecture**
    - Client-Server System
    - Pipe and Filter
    - Model-View-Controller (MVC)
    - Peer-to-Peer Architecture

11. **Client Types**
    - External Users
    - Internal Users
    - Software or Software Components

12. **Testing Types**
    - System Testing
    - Integration Testing
    - Alpha Testing
    - Beta Testing

13. **Software Development Lifecycle Phases**
    - Requirement Gathering
    - Development Phase
    - Design Phase
    - Testing Phase
    - Maintenance Phase

14. **Agile User Stories**
    - Specific
    - Measurable
    - Achievable
    - Relevant
    - Timeboxed

15. **Design Heuristics**
    - Freedom
    - Flexibility
    - Recognition over Recall
    - Show Status

16. **Design Patterns**
    - Factory Design Pattern
    - Builder Design Pattern
    - Adapter Design Pattern
    - Facade Design Pattern

17. **SOLID Principles**
    - Single Responsibility Principle
    - Open-Close Principle
    - Liskov Substitution Principle
    - Interface Segregation Principle (ISP)
    - Dependency Inversion Principle

18. **Requirement Types**
    - Functional Requirements
    - Non-Functional Requirements

19. **Cyclomatic Complexity**
    - Formula: \( \text{Cyclomatic Complexity} = E - N + 2P \)
    - Example: For the `classify_numbers` function, cyclomatic complexity is 4.

20. **Requirement Collection Techniques**
    - Questionnaires
    - Interviews
    - Focus Group
    - Documentation

21. **COCOMO Model**
    - Constants for different project types:
      - Organic project: \( a = 2.4 \), \( b = 1.05 \)
      - Semi-detached project: \( a = 3.0 \), \( b = 1.12 \)
      - Embedded project: \( a = 3.6 \), \( b = 1.20 \)
    - Effort Calculation: \( \text{Effort} = a \times (\text{LOC})^{b} \)
    - Example: For an embedded project with 100,000 lines of code, initial effort = \( 3.6 \times (100,000)^{1.20} \) person-months.

22. **Risk Mitigation**
    - Project Risks
    - Technical Risks
    - Business Risks
    - Mitigation Strategies: Benchmarking, regular inspection, client communication, market exploration.

#### Mermaid Knowledge Graph

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Software Engineering] --> B[Version Control]
    A --> C[Debugging Strategies]
    A --> D[Interview Types]
    A --> E[Cohesion Types]
    A --> F[Coupling and Cohesion]
    A --> G[Diagrams]
    A --> H[Agile Project Management]
    A --> I[Risk Management]
    A --> J[Software Architecture]
    A --> K[Client Types]
    A --> L[Testing Types]
    A --> M[Software Development Lifecycle]
    A --> N[Agile User Stories]
    A --> O[Design Heuristics]
    A --> P[Design Patterns]
    A --> Q[SOLID Principles]
    A --> R[Requirement Types]
    A --> S[Cyclomatic Complexity]
    A --> T[Requirement Collection Techniques]
    A --> U[COCOMO Model]
    A --> V[Risk Mitigation]

    B --> B1[git pull]

    D --> D3[Unstructured Interview]

    E --> E1[Coincidental Cohesion]

    F --> F1[High Cohesion and High Coupling]

    F --> F3[Low Cohesion and Loose Coupling]
    F --> F4[High Cohesion and Loose Coupling]

    G --> G1[Class Diagram]

    G --> G4[Interaction Diagram]

    H --> H1[Sprint Retrospective]

    L --> L3[Alpha Testing]
    L --> L4[Beta Testing]

    M --> M1[Requirement Gathering]

    N --> N1[Specific]

    O --> O1[Freedom]

    P --> P1[Factory Design Pattern]

    Q --> Q1[Single Responsibility Principle]

    Q --> Q3[Liskov Substitution Principle]
    Q --> Q4[Interface Segregation Principle]
    Q --> Q5[Dependency Inversion Principle]

    R --> R1[Functional Requirements]
    R --> R2[Non-Functional Requirements]

    S --> S1[Cyclomatic Complexity Formula]

    T --> T1[Questionnaires]
    T --> T2[Interviews]
    T --> T3[Focus Group]
    T --> T4[Documentation]

    U --> U1[Organic Project]
    U --> U2[Semi-detached Project]
    U --> U3[Embedded Project]

    V --> V1[Project Risks]
    V --> V2[Technical Risks]
    V --> V3[Business Risks]
```

This summary and knowledge graph should help you understand the core topics and their relationships for the exam.
